required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Low Muscle Mass in HNC Treated With Immunotherapy
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Body Composition on the Prognosis and Toxicity of Patients Diagnosed With Recurrence or Metastasic Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck (SCCHN) Treated With Immune Checkpoint Inhibitors (ICI)

collaborator.agency: Department of Health, Generalitat de Catalunya

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to evaluate the baseline muscle mass as a predictive biomarker of treatment response in patients with recurrence or metastatic squamous cell carcinoma of the head and the neck (SCCHN) treated with immune checkpoint inhibitors (ICI)

detailed_description.textblock: Body composition including sarcopenia (loss of muscle mass), sarcopenic obesity, and mioesteaosis has been well reported to be an independent predictors of mortality, toxicity, and complications in cancer patients with different locations and treatments. However, there are currently no data on impact of body composition and the oncological outcomes in SCCHN patients treated with immune checkpoint inhibitors (ICI) due to recurrence or metastasic disease.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the baseline muscle mass as a predictive biomarker of treatment response in patients with recurrence or metastatic squamous cell carcinoma of the head and the neck (SCCHN) treated with immune checkpoint inhibitors (ICI)
primary_outcome.description: Assessed by CT scan at L3 level

secondary_outcome.measure: - To evaluate the impact of malnutrition and weight loss on overall survival, recurrence-free survival, locoregional control, and toxicity in patients with recurrence or metastatic SCCHN treated with immunotherapy-based regimens.
Evaluate baseline muscle mass as a predictive biomarker of toxicity
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed by CT scan at L3 level

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the impact of adipose tissue as a predictor of survival and toxicity
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed by CT scan at L3 level including total adipose tissue, subcutaneous, visceral and intramuscular fat mass
Assessed by CT scan at L3 level

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the need for nutritional support throughout the treatment and the type if so
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, on average of 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluated after performed full nutritional assessment by a checklist with all different options

secondary_outcome.measure: Observe the correlation of a lower muscle mass with an increase in inflammatory parameters and oncological outcomes
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed by CT scan at L3 level and blood sample

clinical_study.condition: Head and Neck Small Cell Carcinoma

study_pop.textblock: A longitudinal prospective study will be carried out of 120 patients with a diagnosis of recurrence or metastatic SCCHN who start treatment with immunotherapy-based regimens at the Institut Català d'Oncologia- L'Hospitalet from November 2020 until the necessary sample size is completed.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients diagnosed with recurrence or metastatic SCCHN treated with antiPDL1, antiPD1 or antiCTLA-4 drugs, alone or in combination within our institution.
- Patients who have previously signed informed consent.
- Patients with measurable tumor lesions.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with non-measurable lesions.
- Patients who do not sign the informed consent.
- Patients not treated with immunotherapy.
- Patients in a double-blind trial in whom the assigned branch is not known.
